turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1860s in Western fashion.
turn.1: What was the influence of the 1860s in Western fashion?
turn.2: It gained immediate success in the Old West among cowboys and settlers, due to its practicality.
turn.3: what was the hats used for?
turn.4: It had a vaguely round ribbon-lined crown and a wide brim, originally straight but soon becoming stylized into the iconic rim of the typical cowboy hat.
turn.6: Its dense felt could be rugged enough to carry water.
turn.7: What other fashion statements were made?
turn.8: Both boys and girls wore skirts from the time they could walk until they reached age 5 or 6.
turn.10: Very small girls wore their skirts just below knee-length over pantalettes.
turn.11: Did the fashion change as they grew?
turn.12: Skirts became very gradually longer as girls grew up until they reached ankle length at coming-out (in their later teens, usually 16-18).
